column2: P MOTOR 1

Color PC drum motor malfunction
 • The color PC drum motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the color PC drum motor is being rotated.

1 Check the M2 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check M2 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 M2 operation check MFPB PJ11MFPB-8 to 14 J-2. 5 Change M2. 6 Change MFPB. 7 Change DCPU.
P MOTOR 2

Transport motor malfunction
 • The transport motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the transport motor is being rotated.

1 Check the M3 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check M3 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 M3 operation check MFPB PJ11MFPB-1 to 7 J-3. 5 Change M3. 6 Change MFPB. 7 Change DCPU.
D MOTOR 2

K developing motor malfunction
 • The K developing motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the K developing motor is being rotated.

1 Check the M5 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check M5 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 M5 operation check MFPB PJ8MFPB-8 to 14 J-4. 5 Change M5. 6 Change MFPB. 7 Change DCPU.
D MOTOR 1

Color developing motor malfunction
 • The color developing motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the color developing motor is being rotated.

1 Check the M1 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 M1 operation check. 4 Change driving unit. 5 Change MFPB. 6 Change DCPU.
FUSER FAN

Fusing fan motor malfunction
 • The fusing fan motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the fusing fan motor is being rotated.

1 Check the FM2 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 FM2 operation check MFPB PJ21MFPB-3 (LOCK) C-10. 4 Change FM2. 5 Change MFPB.
DUPLEX FAN

Duplex cooling fan motor malfunction
 • The duplex cooling fan motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the duplex cooling fan motor is being rotated.

1 Check the FM4 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 FM4 operation check MFPB PJ27MFPB-6 (LOCK) C-2 4 Change FM4. 5 Change MFPB.
OZONE FAN

Ozone ventilation fan motor malfunction
 • The ozone ventilation fan motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the ozone ventilation fan motor is being rotated.

1 Check the FM3 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 FM3 operation check MFPB PJ31MFPB-3 (LOCK) C-11. 4 Change FM3. 5 Change MFPB.
POWER FAN

DC power supply fan motor malfunction
 • The DC power supply fan motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the DC power supply fan motor is being rotated.

1 Check the FM1 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 FM1 operation check MFPB PJ9MFPB-3 (LOCK) C-10 to 11. 4 Change FM1. 5 Change MFPB.
FUSER MOTOR

Fusing motor malfunction
 • The fusing motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the fusing motor is being rotated.

1 Check the M4 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fuser unit driving mechanism for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 M4 operation check MFPB PJ19MFPB-3 to 9 J-3. 5 Change M4. 6 Change MFPB.
XFER DETACH 2

2nd image transfer pressure / retraction failure
 • The 2nd image transfer retraction position sensor is not activated (retracted position) within a given period of time after the retraction sequence of the 2nd transfer roller has been started. • The 2nd image transfer retraction position sensor is not deactivated (pressed position) within a given period of time after the pressure sequence of the 2nd transfer roller has been started.

1 Check the M3 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the CL5 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check M3 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 4 Check CL5 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 5 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 6 PS10 sensor check MFPB PJ16MFPB-8 (ON) C-4 7 CL5 operation check MFPB PJ10MFPB-5 (ON) C-6 8 M3 operation check MFPB PJ11MFPB-1 to 7 J-3 9 Change M3. 10 Change CL5. 11 Change MFPB.
XFER DETACH 1

1st image transfer pressure / retraction failure
 • The 1st image transfer retraction position sensor is not activated (retracted position) within a given period of time after the intermediate transport motor has started rotating. • The 1st image transfer retraction position sensor is not deactivated (pressed position) within a given period of time after the intermediate transport motor has started rotating.

1 Check the M3 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the CL4 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check M3 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 4 Check CL4 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 5 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 6 PS9 sensor check MFPB PJ7MFPB-11 (ON) J-5. 7 CL4 operation check MFPB PJ19MFPB-2 (REM) J-3 to 4. 8 M3 operation check MFPB PJ11MFPB-1 to 7 J-3. 9 Change M3. 10 Change CL4. 11 Change MFPB.
POLYGON MOTOR

Polygon motor malfunction
 • The polygon motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time after it has been started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the polygon motor is being rotated.
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PH unit. 3 Change MFPB.
LASER ERROR

Laser malfunction
 • The SOS signal is not detected within a given period of time after the output of the laser has been started.
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PH unit. 3 Change MFPB.
FUSER ERROR

Heating roller warm-up failure
 • The thermistor /1 does not detect the specified temperature and the warm-up cycle is not completed even after the lapse of a given period of time after the cycle has been started.

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the fuser unit, DCPU, and MFPB for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change fuser unit. 4 Change MFPB. 5 Change DCPU.
TERMISTOR1

Thermistor open-circuit failure
 • The temperature detected by the thermistor does not reach a predetermined level even after the lapse of a given period time after the warm-up cycle has been started.

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the fuser unit, DCPU, and MFPB for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change fuser unit. 4 Change MFPB. 5 Change DCPU.
TERMISTOR2

Thermistor resistance failure
 • The difference between the temperature detected by thermistor/1 and that detected by thermistor/2 exceeds a predetermined value.

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the fuser unit, DCPU, and MFPB for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change fuser unit. 4 Change MFPB. 5 Change DCPU.
FUSER ERROR

Abnormally low heating roller temperature
 • The temperature detected by the thermistor /1 remains lower than the specified value for a given period of time or longer.

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the fuser unit, DCPU, and MFPB for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change fuser unit. 4 Change MFPB. 5 Change DCPU.
FUSER ERROR

Abnormally high heating roller temperature
 • The temperature detected by the thermistor /1 remains higher than the specified value for a given period of time or longer. • The heater lamp remains ON for a given period of time or longer.

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the fuser unit, DCPU, and MFPB for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change fuser unit. 4 Change MFPB. 5 Change DCPU.
PT SENSOR

OHP sensor malfunction
 • It is determined that the OHP sensor is faulty through a check made at the end of the predrive.
1 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 PS7 sensor check MFPB PJ15MFPB-5 (ON) C-5. 3 Change MFPB.
TE SENSOR Y

Toner level sensor /Y malfunction
 • An error occurs on the toner level sensor board (TLSB).
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change TLSB. 3 Change MFPB.
TE SENSOR M

Toner level sensor /M malfunction
 • An error occurs on the toner level sensor board (TLSB).
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change TLSB. 3 Change MFPB.
TE SENSOR C

Toner level sensor /C malfunction
 • An error occurs on the toner level sensor board (TLSB).
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change TLSB. 3 Change MFPB.
TE SENSOR K

Toner level sensor /K malfunction
 • An error occurs on the toner level sensor board (TLSB).
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change TLSB. 3 Change MFPB.
ENGINE H/W ERROR

MFP board malfunction
 • A communication error occurs in MFP board (MFPB).
1 Reboot the main body. 2 Change MFPB.
13DD
EEPROM BK

Backup data error
 • The printer determines that EEPROM is yet to be mounted when the main power switch is turned ON.
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PRCB. 3 Change MFPB.
FLASH WRITE

Flash ROM write error
 • Flash ROM writing is found faulty during a check.
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PRCB. 3 Change MFPB.
FLASH DEVICE

Flash ROM device fault
 • An erase error occurs during erasing of data in flash ROM.
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PRCB. 3 Change MFPB.
ENGINE ERR

Engine control failure
 • An undefined malfunction occurs in the engine section (PRCB, etc.).
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PRCB. 3 Change MFPB.
EEPROM1
Trouble related to security
EEPROM2
Trouble related to security
RAM ERROR

RAM error at startup (expanded memory)
 • RAM error at expanded memory is detected during printer start-up.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check connection state of the standard/ expanded memory and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change the expanded memory. 5 Change PRCB.
H/W ADDRESS

MAC address error at startup
 • Invalid MAC address is detected during printer start-up
1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change PRCB.
BOOT ROM

Boot ROM error at startup
 • Boot ROM error is detected during printer startup.
1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change PRCB.
CONTROLLER ROM

Controller ROM error (Configuration information error)
 • Lead error of destination setting file is detected during the printer starting.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 If this error message is displayed after update of firmware, conduct the firmware update procedures again. 4 Change PRCB.
CONTROLLER ROM

Controller ROM error (Access error)
 • Flash ROM access error is detected during the printer starting.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 If this error message is displayed after update of firmware, conduct the firmware update procedures again. 4 Change PRCB.
CONTROLLER ROM

Controller ROM error (Data error)
 • Final check sum error is detected during the printer starting.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 If this error message is displayed after update of firmware, conduct the firmware update procedures again. 4 Change PRCB.
HDD ERROR

HDD access error
 • When correct access to the hard disk kit is failed during access.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the HDD connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change HDD. 5 Change PRCB.
HDD DISK FULL

HDD full error
 • Range for user space is full during access to the hard disk kit.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Delete the job hold in [PROOF/PRINT MENU] to increase the available range for user space. 3 Check the HDD connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Format HDD with [SYS DEFAULT MENU]- [HDD FORMAT.] 5 Change HDD.
CARD ERROR

Compact flash access error
 • When correct access to the compact flash card is failed during access.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the compact flash for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change compact flash. 5 Change PRCB.
CARD FULL

Compact flash full error
 • Range for user space is full during access to the compact flash card.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Delete the job hold in [PROOF/PRINT MENU] to increase the available range for user space. 3 Check the compact flash for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Format compact flash with [SYS DEFAULT MENU]-[CARD FORMAT.] 5 Change compact flash.
UPDATE ERROR

Firmware update error
 • Firmware update fails to complete correctly during update.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the cable that has been used for update of the firmware for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the firmware update file and if the file is not the correct one, update the firmware again. 4 Check the firmware update procedure and if the procedure is not correct, update the firmware again. 5 Update the firmware again. . . 6 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 7 Change PRCB.
H/W CONFIG ERROR

Hardware configuration error
 • An error occurs with hardware configuration (video clock etc.).
1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change PRCB.
FFFF
I/F COMM ERROR

Interface Communication error
 • Correct communication is failed when receiving/ sending the command between MFPB and PRCB.

1 Reboot the main body. 2 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary 3 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Change MFPB. 5 Change PRCB.
